Comment: What you just quoted is why I seriously doubt this will happen. He tried during his first term and it got shut down for those exact reasons.   If you've ever been to D.C. or are familiar with any of the bases surrounding it, you'd know the infrastructure just doesn't exist, and it is one of the most densely populated places in the country. The dollar cost is one issue, but the physical possibility of it is a real question also. For example, if you wanted to have a few tanks roll down Pennsylvania Ave, it wouldn't just be a few tanks needed. There is a whole maintenance, recovery and fueler section that would have to come with it and be staged nearby somewhere. Then there are the accommodations for the people operating all of that equipment etc. etc.
